dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I should go. But I don't want this to end.

dialogue.speaker: The Architect
dialogue.text: Endings are doorways. And besides, in a universe where consciousness creates reality, have we ever really been separate?

dialogue.speaker: The Architect
dialogue.text: You'll see me everywhere now. In every question, every paradox, every moment of wonder.

actions.action: stands slowly, gathering himself for return to ordinary world
remains seated but somehow fills entire space with presence
waits patiently, threshold between transformation space and daily life
shifts toward evening, marking time's gentle insistence

environment.description: Cafe preparing for transition, late afternoon becoming evening, sacred space releasing its pilgrim back to the world
environment.mood: bittersweet departure, grateful completion, promise of continuation
